intro: Nesogenes euphrasioides var. lineatus, commonly known as the linear euphrasia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its parasitic nature. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats and has small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange and are arranged in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
